Hope this helps!

data.title: Multi-root workspace implementation Roadmap
data.body:
# Roadmap

The forward looking roadmap for multi root support. Work planned for the current iteration is on the corresponding iteration plan.

## October 

### Enable extensions available on the Market place
- [ ] Analyze most popular extensions that use the `rootPath` and workspace settings
- [ ] Engage, file issues and contribute PRs as appropriate

data.title: Word highlighting invisible with Solarized Dark theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:41:25.571Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-54-generic

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|VHDL|mshr-h|0.0.2|
|VerilogHDL|mshr-h|0.0.13|
|vscode-lua|trixnz|0.5.0|;


---

Since a few releases, this is now impossible to see word highlighting with Solarized Dark theme:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8155675/26977153-2315330a-4d27-11e7-8c50-256c965ec277.png)

With the default theme (Dark):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8155675/26977123-075630d8-4d27-11e7-8f36-3a12cbeea6c1.png)

I was often using this feature, but now I cannot more. What I need to do now is search the word to see it: but sometimes I don't want to open the search widget to just find a same word on the screen.

data.title: Inform user about necessity of updating Transifex resources to pull
data.body:
Transifex API does not allow to pull all resources per project, hence currently we have an array of resources to pull in `i18n.ts` for `gulp vscode-translations-pull` task. 

With any changes around `workbench/parts` or `workbench/resources` (e.g. adding/removing part or resource) developers are required to update this array in order to pull translations for the part/service. 

**Problem:** Currently this it is not visible for a developer when resource has to be updated.

**Solution:** Write TSLint rule that will inform a developer if he has not added resource to an array.

data.title: Shortcut hints are not displayed correctly when the editor area is empty
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Arch Linux (maybe applicable to other platforms, I think)

If the default UI language is set to English, keyboard shortcuts are displayed correctly like this:

![2017-06-09 19-44-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2667858/26972819-529107cc-4d4e-11e7-8081-dc8f6d839b24.png)

However, If I change the language to Korean, "Ctrl"s and "Shift"s are gone.

![2017-06-09 19-43-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2667858/26972825-5576b41e-4d4e-11e7-883d-34d68cba30ed.png)

I'm not sure if other languages also break this screen, but I guess some languages will probably do.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change the UI language to Korean(or anything other than English).
2. Restart VSCode to apply new language config.
3. Make sure there is nothing opened in the editor area.

data.title: [Feature Request] Search text in Terminal, Output, Console and/or any editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Any

It would be really powerful and flexible to be able to search using the common inline search widget (ctrl+f) in the Terminal window, Debug Console, Output, Problems window as if they were common Editors.
The same would be nice for the Extension windows, the screen that shows the information about an extension has no way to search text.

If any of you has ever worked with emacs, you'd probably know the advantadges of being able to search anywhere.

Thank you and congrats for this geat editor.

data.title: Terminal prompt shows PWD twice after update
data.body: VSCode Version: 1.13.0 OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12 Steps to Reproduce: Open terminal CD to any dir The prompt shows the PWD twice. When you type one of the iterations of pwd disappears then reappears when typing has ceased. Makes it hard to track what commands you are typing? Issue also experienced by @tomitrescak

data.title: File reformatting to 4 spaces for indentation on save.
data.body:
EDIT: It's not just indentation. It reformats the file to some defaults it sees fit. `a=b;c=d;` gets spit into multiple lines on saving. Also, replicated this issue in HTML files.

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a JavaScript project in a workspace. (Was unable to reproduce in a typescript and go project. But verified in 2 different javascript projects).
2. Open a file using 2 spaces for indentation. Hit Cmd-S for <save>. The file reformats to 4 spaces.

When I open the file, the indent guides are at 2 stops. The status bar says `Spaces: 2`. But hitting save reformats the code to 4 spaces. Happens with eslint enabled and disabled. No workspace settings. Global setting has `files.formatOnSave` as `off` by default and `editor.tabSize` as `2`. This has started happening recently after updating to the latest version.

If I reopen the file now, the status bar says `Spaces: 4` with 4 spaces in indent guides. Now I select `Indent using Spaces` > `2`, and `Reindent Lines`. This restores the 2 spaces formatting. But hitting save again turns the 2 spaces into 4.

data.title: Only show tree views for activated extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 (1.13.0)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an extension, with a tree view
2. Open up a folder where the tree view isn't activated
3. See the indicator for the tree view


---

Hey all - **so cool** that we can do some user interface work now! I [built an extension straight away](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Orta.vscode-react-native-storybooks)

![preview](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49038/26970386-1a86fb18-4d01-11e7-8929-4c79b7a95101.gif)

This extension is only really useful for a few of the projects I work on daily, and so I was hoping that because it has a pretty limited set of activation events the section for Storybooks would only show in the cases of the activation. If I can't give it a provider, then there's not much that can be done with the UI.

data.title: 'go to definition' no longer working
data.body:
This may be new configuration that I've missed, but cmd/ctrl+click no longer goes to definition. F12 also doesn't seem to work.

I've tested this in Dart and Java. A colleague has experienced the same thing on OSX but seems to work fine on Windows 10 (both when upgrading from 1.12 -> 1.13)

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 (1.13.0)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open project
2. Cmd/ctrl+click term or select term and press F12

data.title: Goto File slow on full path search
data.body:
Goto File is very slow when you search for a path (ie there is a slash in the search). It looks like it is not able to search the index and instead crawls through the project directories.
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type folder name 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12103148/26967664-fcdf57d6-4cf6-11e7-8222-ae4f2cbfd45b.png)
List display instantly

2. Add part of filename
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12103148/26968280-5e394f12-4cf9-11e7-9b72-898343687c07.png)
List takes ages to show results (loading strip shows). Does not seem to use the matches below.
